arts.ttl: Chelsea handed huge Romeo Lavia boost as Enzo Maresca confirms Liverpool availability
arts.sum: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca has confirmed Romeo Lavia is in contention to start against Liverpool in the Premier League. “The target with Romeo is that we can help him and we can bring him in the same condition as Wes and Reece, where they can play games.

arts.ttl: Chalobah, Andrey Santos, Lavia, Palmer: All the latest Chelsea team news vs Liverpool
arts.sum: "Since I joined the club, every time I spoke about Benoit, I always said that for me personally, he's an important player," Maresca told reporters. Chelsea are looking to end a run of three league matches without a win, with Maresca's side losing their previous two against Manchester United and Brighton & Hove Albion.

arts.ttl: Enzo Maresca expresses concerns over Chelsea's defensive line ahead of Liverpool clash
arts.sum: In addition to Trevoh Chalobah's suspension, Maresca's only obvious centre-back options for Saturday's match against Liverpool are Benoit Badiashile, Josh Acheampong, and Jorrel Hato. Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca admitted that not having a consistent defensive line has been problematic, but he still trusts the remaining available centre-back options.

arts.ttl: Maresca reveals Lavia game-time plan ahead of Chelsea, Liverpool showdown
arts.sum: Chelsea head coach Enzo Maresca reveals his plans for midfielder Romeo Lavia ahead of Saturday's Premier League showdown with Liverpool at Stamford Bridge.

arts.ttl: Liverpool assessing options that could spoil ideal Chelsea transfer move
arts.sum: Liverpool are reportedly considering strengthening in central defence in the upcoming January transfer window, and that could mean a move for a Chelsea target. Sporting Lisbon centre-back Ousmane Diomande was on Chelsea’s list in the summer, though in the end they opted for Jorrel Hato instead.
